source.longname: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
source.spanish_name: Oficina del Alto Comisionado de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados
source.name: UN High Commissioner for Refugees

fields.title: Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, March 2023
fields.body:
The Syria crisis entered its thirteenth year in March 2023. The UN estimates that 15.3 million people need humanitarian assistance across the country, a 5 per cent increase from 2022.

The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation in Syria, and UNHCR is responding to this new emergency. An estimated 8.8 million people in Syria were affected by the earthquakes.

UNHCR also continues to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members based on identified needs and vulnerabilities.

The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation in Syria, and UNHCR is responding to this new emergency. An estimated 8.8 million people in Syria were affected by the earthquakes.

UNHCR also continues to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members based on identified needs and vulnerabilities.

text:
# Syria: UNHCR Operational Update, March 2023

The Syria crisis entered its thirteenth year in March 2023. The UN estimates that 15.3 million people need humanitarian assistance across the country, a 5 per cent increase from 2022.

The 6 February earthquakes further exacerbated the situation in Syria, and UNHCR is responding to this new emergency. An estimated 8.8 million people in Syria were affected by the earthquakes.

UNHCR also continues to provide protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members based on identified needs and vulnerabilities.
summary: The Syria crisis has been ongoing for 13 years, with 15.3 million people in need of humanitarian assistance. The 6 February earthquakes have further exacerbated the situation, with 8.8 million people affected. UNHCR is responding to the new emergency and providing protection and assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced people, returnees, stateless people, and host community members.
